Yeah this is frankly awful, Sorry not Sorry but its just as bad as it was at launch especially monetarily.

I still wish we had Launch OG Overwatch cause frankly that was at its peak, its all been downhill from there.

I have ~1600 hours in this game. The gameplay can still be fun, but the way Blizzard has gutted the game to rake in maximum profits is extremely heartbreaking and a big F U to the community. It's sad seeing my favourite game of all time being tortured and left to die.

I love buying stuff for a game I love just to not get it yay. Its a good game but pissed off at the fact that i payed for dlc and didn't get dlc content.

Been wanting to leave a negative review on this pile of trash since Overwatch 2's launch.

Having stuck with the game for well over 6 years, the absolute mockery that Blizzard Entertainment have made of its entire playerbase is inexcusable. They see their customers only as wallets, and this game as a cow to be milked until it's dry and ready for slaughter.

The egregious monetization present since the launch of the so-called "sequel" is what's driving this game into the dirt. The entire purpose of its existence, the massive PvE campaign it was supposed to have, has been scrapped in place of smaller missions costing $5 a pop at roughly 30 minutes playtime with zero replayability. Now they vow to "re-commit" to PvP, which is in its absolute worst state ever in terms of balancing, and characters locked behind paywalls at $9 each.

This leaves Overwatch 2, in comparison to its predecessor, as a worthless money-grabbing shop update with changes to the core gameplay that only make it worse.

Don't even bother. It's over.
I've done my part!

P.S. I dearly hope the art, animation, and writing teams for the game's story and cinematics can be hired onto a project they're passionate about, one that isn't careening into the Pacific.
Where are the oiled up Tracer and Widowmaker skins?
Overwatch 1 was a far better game. But hey this still has the legendary winston overwatch so I can't complain (Do not play!!!!!1)

[b]Positives:[/b] The newly added game mode, Flashpoint, is good, and the maps are well-designed. The new hero, Illari, feels fun to play.

[b]Negatives:[/b] The introduction of the Push game mode and Battle Pass when OverwatchÂ® 2 was launched, as well as the paywalled story, have completely ruined a game that was once so great. The matchmaking in competitive mode is a complete joke, and I can only recommend this if you enjoy the sensation of losing your mind.

A sequel with less and worse content. Sprinkling crumbs through a greedy, needless, grind marathon. Shame on whoever is left at Blizzard for not even leaving the bones of "Overwatch 1" for this absolute pile of mess.

Blizzard, I fucked your mother with an old mother. I fucking pushed her. You fucking don't treat China players as people, do you? I'm your 18th generation ancestor, fuck you. What did you say about the data of the previous account? Your mother forced me to say no, and it was gone. I'm telling you, this good game is blind for nothing, and his grandmother is a hammer. At first, he went online with steam, and your grandmother is a hammer, so he can't play simplified Chinese. Later, he definitely thought that the players in China could not earn money. You mlgb, and you got the simplified Chinese, so you and he. You son of a bitch, why don't you die? I'm looking forward to your death. Damn it, I gave you this bad review, and I gave it to you in a different number. I'll give you a bad review if it's a big deal, but do you have anything to match? I feel bad about spending money on you, fuck you.

Fix your game blizzard. I get that yall probably tried to make it buggy so people don't play on steam but this is not playable at all. I have had nothing but crap experience in playing when it was all fine before. I don't know why y'all still think of ways to improve when it just turns things bad. Just stop touching the game at this point. (also nerf genji)

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
